intro: Psychotria iwahigensis, commonly known as the Iwahig Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines, specifically occurring in the mountainous regions of Luzon. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in primary lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
